beaches.name: Bondi Beach
beaches.description: Australia's most iconic crescent of sand, where urban energy meets rolling Pacific swells. The legendary Icebergs pool stands sentinel at the southern tip, offering a stunning contrast of man-made structure against the wild, azure ocean.
beaches.shortDescription: Sydney's legendary surf and lifestyle hub.

beaches.name: Maldives (Atolls)
beaches.description: A garland of islands scattered across the Indian Ocean, offering the ultimate castaway fantasy. Here, the water is so clear it looks like liquid glass, and overwater bungalows provide a front-row seat to an underwater world of vibrant coral and marine life.
beaches.shortDescription: The quintessential luxury island escape.

beaches.name: Bora Bora
beaches.description: Known as the Pearl of the Pacific, this lagoon features every shade of blue imaginable, guarded by the dramatic peak of Mount Otemanu. It is a place of hypnotic beauty where shallow sandbars meet deep indigo channels.
beaches.shortDescription: A world-famous lagoon of neon blue water.

beaches.name: Copacabana Beach
beaches.description: A vibrating pulse of Carioca culture, defined by its mosaic boardwalk and Sugarloaf Mountain backdrop. This is where the city comes to play, a theater of life filled with football, samba, and sun-worshippers stretching for 4 kilometers.
beaches.shortDescription: The world's most famous urban beach party.

beaches.name: Maya Bay
beaches.description: Encircled by towering limestone cliffs, this sheltered bay is a masterpiece of nature made famous by 'The Beach'. After extensive rehabilitation, its waters are once again crystal clear and teeming with baby sharks, though swimming is now strictly regulated to protect the coral.
beaches.shortDescription: The cinematic paradise enclosed by limestone cliffs.

beaches.name: Whitehaven Beach
beaches.description: Seven kilometers of blindingly white silica sand that never gets hot to the touch. The Hill Inlet at the northern end creates a mesmerizing fusion of colors as the tide shifts, swirling the sand and turquoise water into a living painting.
beaches.shortDescription: Swirling silica sands and turquoise waters.

beaches.name: Anse Source d'Argent
beaches.description: A surreal landscape of giant, sculpted granite boulders scattered across shallow turquoise water and pinkish sand. This beach feels prehistoric and secluded, protected by a reef that keeps the waters calm and glass-like.
beaches.shortDescription: Granite boulders meet shallow turquoise lagoons.

beaches.name: Navagio Beach (Shipwreck)
beaches.description: A dramatic cove enclosed by sheer white cliffs, home to the rusting hull of the MV Panagiotis. The electric blue water contrasts sharply with the white pebbles, creating one of the most photographed vistas in the Mediterranean.
beaches.shortDescription: Dramatic cliffs guarding a famous shipwreck.

beaches.name: Pink Sands Beach
beaches.description: Three miles of soft sand blushed with a delicate rose hue derived from microscopic coral insects. The beach is wide, cool to walk on, and borders calm waters protected by outlying reefs, offering an atmosphere of upscale serenity.
beaches.shortDescription: Endless stretches of blushing rose-colored sand.

beaches.name: Grace Bay
beaches.description: A hallmark of perfection, Grace Bay offers exceptionally clean, turquoise water and sugar-white sand free of rocks or seaweed. Protected by a barrier reef a mile offshore, the water is consistently calm and safe.
beaches.shortDescription: The gold standard for Caribbean beaches.

beaches.name: Railay Beach
beaches.description: Accessible only by longtail boat due to high limestone cliffs cutting it off from the mainland. It is a haven for rock climbers and sunset lovers, offering a bohemian atmosphere with stunning karst scenery.
beaches.shortDescription: Limestone cliffs meet emerald waters.

beaches.name: Lanikai Beach
beaches.description: Meaning 'Heavenly Sea', this beach lives up to its name with powdery sand and calm waters overlooking the twin Mokulua Islands. It sits in a quiet residential neighborhood, lacking large facilities but making up for it with sheer beauty.
beaches.shortDescription: A heavenly strip of sand with iconic twin island views.

beaches.name: Tulum Beach
beaches.description: Where ancient Mayan history meets bohemian luxury. The ruins of a fortress watch over the Caribbean sea, while down the coast, eco-chic beach clubs and jungle restaurants create a trendy, mystical atmosphere.
beaches.shortDescription: Ancient ruins overlooking bohemian Caribbean sands.

beaches.name: El Nido (Bacuit Bay)
beaches.description: A gateway to the Bacuit Archipelago, featuring dramatic black limestone cliffs guarding secret lagoons and pristine white pockets of sand. The water here is a striking mix of emerald and teal.
beaches.shortDescription: Secret lagoons hidden among limestone karsts.

beaches.name: Cannon Beach
beaches.description: A rugged, atmospheric coastline defined by the towering Haystack Rock. It's not a beach for swimming, but for long walks in the mist, exploring tide pools filled with starfish, and bonfire evenings.
beaches.shortDescription: Moody Pacific coast famous for Haystack Rock.

beaches.name: Reynisfjara Beach
beaches.description: A stunningly dark and dangerous beauty featuring ink-black sand, geometric basalt columns, and roaring Atlantic waves. It creates a gothic, otherworldly atmosphere that demands respect due to its famous 'sneaker waves'.
beaches.shortDescription: Dramatic black sand and basalt columns.

beaches.name: Matira Beach
beaches.description: The largest public access beach on Bora Bora, Matira stretches out as a mile-long peninsula of soft white sand. The water is impossibly shallow and warm, perfect for wading hundreds of meters out toward the barrier reef.
beaches.shortDescription: Bora Bora's stunning public white-sand mile.

beaches.name: Radhanagar Beach
beaches.description: Voted as one of the best beaches in Asia, Radhanagar Beach on Havelock Island is a pristine stretch of white sand and turquoise water, backed by lush green forests. It's famous for its stunning sunsets and calm, clear waters.
beaches.shortDescription: Asia's pristine paradise in the Andamans.

beaches.name: Varkala Beach
beaches.description: Famous for its dramatic red cliffs overlooking the Arabian Sea, Varkala Beach is a unique destination in Kerala. The cliffs are dotted with cafes and shops, and the beach below is known for its natural springs and spiritual significance.
beaches.shortDescription: Dramatic cliffs and spiritual springs in Kerala.

beaches.name: Palolem Beach
beaches.description: A crescent-shaped beach in South Goa, Palolem is known for its calm waters and colorful wooden shacks. It's a favorite for those seeking a more laid-back and scenic experience compared to the busier beaches of North Goa.
beaches.shortDescription: Crescent-shaped serenity in South Goa.

beaches.name: Marina Beach
beaches.description: One of the longest urban beaches in the world, Marina Beach is the heart of Chennai. It's a vibrant hub of activity, especially in the evenings, with food stalls, amusement rides, and a bustling atmosphere.
beaches.shortDescription: The world's second longest urban beach.

beaches.name: Puri Beach
beaches.description: A sacred beach on the Bay of Bengal, Puri Beach is famous for its golden sands and the annual Rath Yatra festival. It's a popular pilgrimage site and also known for its sand art and vibrant beach markets.
beaches.shortDescription: Golden sands and spiritual significance in Odisha.

beaches.name: Seven Mile Beach
beaches.description: A crescent of coral-sand perfection that hosts the island's best resorts. Despite its development, the beach is wide enough to feel spacious, with calm, crystal-clear water ideal for floating and swimming.
beaches.shortDescription: Resort-lined perfection with crystal clear water.

beaches.name: Playa Paraiso
beaches.description: True to its name 'Paradise Beach', this wide stretch in Tulum is famous for its leaning palm trees and vast, open sands. It is less crowded than the northern hotel zone, offering a quintessential Caribbean postcard experience.
beaches.shortDescription: Iconic leaning palms and wide white sands.

beaches.name: Praia da Marinha
beaches.description: The jewel of the Algarve, famous for its golden limestone cliffs, double sea arches, and turquoise water. The view from the clifftops is as impressive as the beach itself, which is reached by a long staircase.
beaches.shortDescription: Golden cliffs and sea arches on the Algarve coast.

beaches.name: Hidden Beach (Playa del Amor)
beaches.description: A secret sandy cove hidden inside a crater-like hole in the lush green island roof. Accessible only by swimming through a short tunnel at low tide, it offers a surreal and exclusive experience regulated by conservation efforts.
beaches.shortDescription: A secret beach inside a cave, accessible by swim only.

beaches.name: Flamenco Beach
beaches.description: A horseshoe of blindingly white sand on the island of Culebra. It is famous for its graffiti-covered rusty tank, a relic of the US Navy, which now sits as an art installation against the backdrop of pristine turquoise waves.
beaches.shortDescription: Pristine sands with iconic graffiti-covered tanks.

beaches.name: Horseshoe Bay Beach
beaches.description: Bermuda's most famous beach, renowned for its curved shape and pale pink sand. Dramatic rock formations create sheltered coves for swimming, while the main stretch offers fun waves and vibrant blue water.
beaches.shortDescription: Famous pink sands curved in a horseshoe shape.

beaches.name: Nusa Dua Beach
beaches.description: A manicured sanctuary of luxury, contrasting with the rest of Bali's hustle. White sands are swept daily, and the water is calm and reef-protected, making it ideal for families and those seeking a resort-style experience.
beaches.shortDescription: Manicured luxury and calm waters in Bali.

beaches.name: Bavaro Beach
beaches.description: The epitome of the Caribbean all-inclusive dream. Endless rows of coconut palms lean over wide white sands, while catamaran party boats bob in the turquoise distance. It is bustling, fun, and picture-perfect.
beaches.shortDescription: Palm-lined perfection in the heart of Punta Cana.

beaches.name: Camps Bay
beaches.description: Cape Town's 'glamour mile', backed by the majestic Twelve Apostles mountain range. The water is icy cold, but the scene is hot—filled with chic bars, sunset cocktails, and stunning views.
beaches.shortDescription: Chic beach strip backed by majestic mountains.

beaches.name: Zlatni Rat
beaches.description: The 'Golden Horn' of Croatia, a pebble spit that changes shape with the wind and tide. It juts perpendicularly into the sapphire Adriatic Sea, backed by fragrant pine groves and offering excellent windsurfing conditions.
beaches.shortDescription: A shape-shifting pebble spit in the Adriatic.

beaches.name: Anse Lazio
beaches.description: Often cited as one of the world's most beautiful beaches, featuring soft white sand, clear lapis lazuli waters, and granite boulders at each end. Unlike other Seychelles beaches, it has no coral reef, creating fun rolling waves.
beaches.shortDescription: Picture-perfect crescent with granite boulders.

beaches.name: Elafonissi Beach
beaches.description: A magical lagoon where the sand turns pink from crushed shells. You can walk through knee-deep turquoise water to the island, which is a protected nature reserve offering dunes and cedar trees.
beaches.shortDescription: Pink sands and shallow lagoon waters.

beaches.name: Cable Beach
beaches.description: The playground of Nassau, featuring 2.5 miles of white sand lined with massive resorts and casinos. The water is calm and sapphire blue, offering a classic Bahamian vacation experience with every amenity at your fingertips.
beaches.shortDescription: Nassau's resort hub with calm blue waters.
